headline.main: Obama Offers Turkey's Erdogan Condolences on Nightclub Attack - White House
headline.print_headline: Obama Offers Turkey's Erdogan Condolences on Nightclub Attack - White House

docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama spoke by telephone on Tuesday with Turkish President Tayyip Erdogan to offer his condolences for those killed and wounded in an attack on an Istanbul nightclub on Dec. 31 for which the Islamic State has claimed responsibility, the White House said in a statement.

headline.main: Glad to See Obama Go, Gulf Arabs Expect Trump to Counter Iran
headline.print_headline: Glad to See Obama Go, Gulf Arabs Expect Trump to Counter Iran

docs.lead_paragraph: Gulf Arab states are quietly applauding the arrival in the White House of a hawkish leader opposed to their adversary Iran, even if they suspect Donald Trump's short temper and abrasive Tweets may at times heighten tensions in the combustible Middle East.

headline.main: Obama, Pence Harden 'Obamacare' Battle Lines at Capitol
headline.print_headline: Obama, Pence Harden 'Obamacare' Battle Lines at Capitol

docs.lead_paragraph: Hardening battle lines for the brawl to come, President Barack Obama urged congressional Democrats to "look out for the American people" in defending his legacy health care overhaul, while Vice President-elect Mike Pence stood firm Wednesday in telling Republicans that dismantling "Obamacare" is No. 1 on Donald Trump's list.

headline.main: After Paladino’s Racist Remarks, Buffalo School Board Demands He Resign
headline.print_headline: Paladino Told to Step Down After Slurs on Obamas

docs.lead_paragraph: The Buffalo Board of Education asked Mr. Paladino to leave over his remarks about the Obamas. He responded, “It’s going to be a very combative year.”

docs.abstract: A salacious video tribute to presidential candidate Barack Obama isn't going over well with his kids.
docs.lead_paragraph: The "Obama Girl" video -- that spicy homage to Illinois Senator and presidential candidate Barack Obama -- has been steaming up computer screens since its debut in June. The clip has racked up more than 3.1 million views on YouTube.

headline.main: Trump Can Do Plenty on His Own to Unravel Obama Health Law
headline.print_headline: Trump Can Do Plenty on His Own to Unravel Obama Health Law

docs.lead_paragraph: President Donald Trump can do plenty on his own to unravel the Obama health care law, but some of those actions would create disruptions that undermine his administration's early promises. Other less sweeping steps could open the way for big changes, but might not get as much notice.
